{{disambig-two|the region where the [[Master of Lake-town]] died|large northern region|[[Northern Waste]]}}
The '''Waste''' was a region that was located somewhere within [[Middle-earth]].<ref name=Stage>{{H|Stage}}</ref>

== History ==
After the [[Battle of Five Armies]], [[Bard]] gave a large amount of gold to the [[Master of Lake-town]] to help the [[Lake-men]]. However, the Master caught the dragon-sickness, stole most of the gold and fled with it from [[Lake-town]].<ref name=Stage/> After his companions had deserted him, he starved to death in the Waste,<ref name=Stage/> sometime between {{TA|2941}} and {{TA|2949|n}}.<ref group="note">The old Master could have died any time between the end of the [[Quest of Erebor]] ({{TA|2941}}) and [[Gandalf]] and [[Balin|Balin's]] visit to Bilbo in {{TA|2949}}.</ref><ref>{{App|TA}}, entries for the years 2941 and 2949, p. 1089</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In an earlier version of the [[The Last Stage]] chapter, the Master was murdered by his companions for the gold and thrown into the waste afterwards. In a modification of this earlier version, the Master's companions simply left him and the Master died of starvation in the waste.<ref name=Back>{{HH|Back}}</ref> In a slightly later version, the Master died of starvation within the waste without any companions being mentioned.<ref name=End>{{HH|End}}</ref> The word ''waste'' was uncapitalized in all of those versions.<ref name=Back/><ref name=End/>

== Speculation ==
It is possible that the capitalization of the word ''Waste'' within the published book may have been a mistake or a last minute change by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] or by the publisher.{{Fact}} [[Robert Foster]] has suggested that the ''Waste'' may possibly have been another name for the [[Desolation of the Dragon|Desolation of Smaug]],<ref>{{HM|Guide}}, entry Waste, p. 419</ref> though how he came to this conclusion is unknown.
